levels.name: Basic Move
levels.title: Level 1: Basic Movement
levels.description: Learn how to move pieces. Move allows a piece to move to any adjacent cell.
levels.objective:
Select red piece 6, click the red circle.
Move: Move to any adjacent empty cell.

levels.name: Jump Escape
levels.title: Level 2: Jump Over Pieces
levels.description: Jump allows a piece to jump over any adjacent piece. Help the blue piece escape from the red pieces' encirclement.
levels.objective:
Select blue piece 0, use jump moves to escape.
Jump: Jump over adjacent piece to empty cell.

levels.name: Span Calculation
levels.title: Level 3: Span Calculation
levels.description: Use span calculation to move pieces. Move red piece 8 to the right of red piece 9.
levels.objective:
Select red piece 8, click the red box (right of red 9).

Single Span Rule:
Calculate spanned pieces using +, -, ×, or ÷ to equal the spanning piece's number.

Key Points:
• Empty spaces: unlimited
• Landing: empty cell after last spanned piece
• All spanned pieces used once
• Spanning piece's number NOT used

levels.name: Continuous Span
levels.title: Level 4: Continuous Span Calculation
levels.description: Use continuous span calculation. Move red piece 1 to the right of blue piece 6.
levels.objective:
Select red piece 1, click the red box (right of blue 6).

Continuous Span Rule:
Span over 2+ segments where each calculates to the SAME value. Trains convergent thinking.

Key Points:
• Spanning piece's number ≠ segment value
• Landing point on same line as next segment
• Segment sizes can differ
• Empty spaces: unlimited
• Segments can be on same or different lines

levels.name: Game End
levels.title: Level 5: Game End
levels.description: Learn how the game ends. The game ends when one side's pieces all reach the opponent's camp.
levels.objective:
Select blue piece 9, move to last cell of Red camp (left of Blue 8).

Scoring Rules:
When one side's 10 pieces occupy all opponent's camp positions, that side can "call stop". Both sides then calculate scores.

Calculation Method (Product-Sum):
Piece number × Position number = Piece score. Sum all piece scores = Total score.

Example: Piece 8 at position 4 = 8×4=32; Piece 6 at position 3 = 6×3=18; Total = 32+18=50.

Perfect match (highest): 0×0+1×1+...+9×9 = 285 points.
Worst match (lowest): 0×9+1×8+...+9×0 = 120 points.

levels.name: Select Path
levels.title: Level 6: Move Blue 0
levels.description: Move the blue piece 0 to the target position (4, 10) in exactly 1 move.
levels.objective:
Select blue piece 0, move it to position (4, 10) in exactly 1 move.

You must complete this in a single move. If you take more than 1 move, you fail.
